page.title: 05CHURCHES IN BUNGAY.
page.content: Earsham Church was built in the 14th century and restored in 1880.Rev.J. Walden is responsible for this church and others.The Holy Trinity is in the centre of Bungay,it is of Saxon origin and has a well preserved round tower made of flint and rubble.St.Marys church in the centre of Bungay,has connections with a ruined priory of Norman origin and is being restored. St.Edmunds Roman Catholic is ornate, having stained glass windows and carved panels,near St.Marys.The United Reformed and Methodist Emmanuel Church is housed in a Georgian building in Upper Olland Street.Bungay Cemetry is separate from the churches on the outskirts of Bungay with three parts to its grounds and a small chapel.All Churches above are active except St. Marys.
